description.b: 3ALib is a Java executable that may be used in the post-migration phase for the Cloud user to monitor the SLA adherence of their availability-based SLAs. The library is abstracted and follows the provider’s definition of availability, in their respective SLA, thus it can be used for compensation purposes claims.

item.title: Configure the properties file with your information

description.b: Indicate in the properties file their attributes, such as Cloud username and API key, local database credentials (for storing the results), Cloud provider name for which they want to start the SLA auditing etc.

Run the command to launch the auditor (missing input). This is a continuous process and should not be stopped, in order to gather all necessary logs. If the process is interrupted for any reason, then this interrupted interval is measured as available, as stated in the providers’ SLAs.
Run the Availability Extractor (missing input) to process the logs and extract the statistics based on the specific provider’s definition as stated in the SLA.
